solution.text: Consider each second's velocity as the terms of a sequence. Then \(a_1 = _{p}_ \) at 0 sec , \( a_2=_{{p+10}}_ \) at 1 sec and \( a_3=_{{p+20}}_\) at 2 sec. The deference between each term is \( a_2 - a_1 = a_3-a_2=10 \). Therefore \( a_4= a_3 + 10= _{{p+30}}_ \) at 3 sec , \( a_5=a_4 + 10 = _{{p+40}}_ \) at 4 sec.

content.text: Imagine you threw a coin to the wishing well at a velocity of _{p}_ m/s. If the coin's velocity after first and second seconds are _{{p+10}}_ m/s and _{{p+20}}_ m/s respectively, what will the speed of coin be after 4 seconds (Assume its a free fall).
